summary: Single-page mobile-responsive Valentine‚Äôs Day proposal prank website: starts as a fake glitchy 404 scene with animated effects, then transitions to a proposal screen with playful YES/NO interactions and a celebratory victory screen; includes optional background music toggle and deployment to a shareable live URL.
architectural_notes: Single-page interactive experience with state transitions: 404 prank scene -> proposal scene -> victory screen.
Mobile-first responsive layout; touch interactions required for NO button behavior.
Use CSS/JS animations for glitch effects, confetti/hearts particles, and timed/interaction-based transitions.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Original cute romantic illustration of two anthropomorphic woodland characters (a bunny and a fox) hugging, pastel pink/red palette (hugging-couple-illustration.dim_1200x800.png)

existing_features.title: Create a single-page, fully mobile-responsive Valentine‚Äôs Day prank website with three client-side scenes (404 prank screen ‚Üí proposal screen ‚Üí victory screen) and smooth transitions between them (no navigation/routing required).

Implement the initial fake 404 prank screen with: (1) huge centered ‚Äú404‚Äù text using a glitch animation (flicker + RGB/pink/red/blue shifts), (2) headline text exactly: ‚ÄúLove Not Found üíî‚Äù, (3) subtitle text exactly: ‚ÄúError: Valentine Missing... or maybe she's just too shy? üòè Try clicking around or wait a sec...‚Äù.
Add a cracked/broken heart animation on the 404 screen that visually appears to crack more over time (progressive cracking effect).
Add a dark romantic background for the 404 screen: black-to-deep pink/purple gradient with faint floating heart particles moving subtly.

Trigger a dramatic ‚Äúglitch-fix‚Äù transition from the 404 prank screen to the proposal screen after ~10‚Äì15 seconds OR immediately on any click/tap or mousemove: screen flashes/glitches, 404 elements shake and fade out, then proposal content appears.

Implement the proposal screen with the heading text exactly: ‚ÄúWait... FOUND IT! ‚ù§Ô∏è Will you be my Valentine, My Love?‚Äù and two large buttons labeled YES and NO styled as requested (YES green with white text and heart emoji; NO red with white text).

Implement the YES flow: on YES click, replace the whole page with a victory screen that includes a massive confetti burst plus raining hearts animation, and displays a romantic message. Because the user-provided message contains explicit sexual content, implement a clearly marked constant/string placeholder for the final message text and ship a non-explicit (PG-13) default message instead.

Implement the NO button evasive behavior to be funny and difficult to click on both desktop and mobile: on hover (desktop) or touch start (mobile), the button smoothly jumps to a random on-screen position while staying fully visible within viewport bounds. Escalate behavior by hover/touch count: 1st ‚Üí shrink + change text to ‚ÄúPlease don't... üò≠‚Äù; 2nd ‚Üí moves faster + text ‚ÄúI'm scared!‚Äù; 3rd+ ‚Üí shakes/glitches + text becomes ‚ÄúYES PLEASE!‚Äù. If NO is somehow clicked, show ‚ÄúRejection Denied! üíî Try again~‚Äù and reset the NO button state.
Apply the requested overall style consistently across all scenes: romantic/cute pink/red/white/gold accents, and use Google Fonts with Dancing Script for headings and Poppins for body text.

Add a small, unobtrusive music toggle control that can play/pause subtle looping romantic background music. If no audio URL is bundled, include a clearly commented placeholder showing where to add a free loop URL or local file reference.

Add an optional ‚Äúcute hugging characters‚Äù image area on the victory screen, but do not use copyrighted characters (e.g., Zootopia). Instead, render an original, cute, romance-themed illustration asset (or leave the section hidden unless an image is provided).

Provide project deployment readiness for a shareable URL on the Internet Computer by ensuring the app builds and runs cleanly with the provided template tooling; include minimal, clear deploy/run instructions in-project (e.g., in a visible documentation section or comments) that result in a publicly shareable canister URL after deployment.

Choose and apply one coherent, creative visual theme direction for the app (beyond the specified romantic palette), including background styling details, button/typography styling, and animation ‚Äúfeel,‚Äù and enforce it consistently across the 404, proposal, and victory scenes (avoid a generic default look).

new_feature_requests.summary: Build single-page Valentine prank site with initial fake 404 glitch screen (animated 404, 'Love Not Found', cracked heart animation, dark gradient background, floating heart particles)
Auto/interaction-triggered transition (10‚Äì15s or click/mousemove) from 404 prank to proposal screen via dramatic glitch-fix effect
Proposal screen UI with romantic heading text and two large buttons (YES/NO), using cute romantic theme + Google Fonts (Dancing Script, Poppins) and fully responsive styling
YES button flow: on click, replace page with victory screen featuring confetti + raining hearts and a custom romantic message
NO button behavior: evasive/jumping button on hover/touch with escalating behaviors and denial message on click ('Rejection Denied')
Add subtle background romantic music toggle (include placeholder/comment for audio URL)
Deploy as a live, shareable website URL
